Bid for glamour shearing record to be made near Dannevirkehttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/bid-for-glamour-shearing-record-to-be-made-near-dannevirke/AMINJC3D3BFLVB4VDV77GMDNMQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/bid-for-glamour-shearing-record-to-be-made-near-dannevirke/AMINJC3D3BFLVB4VDV77GMDNMQ/ Doug LaingThe world solo 9hrs lambshearing record is 872 – now there's a challenger. Wed, 23 Oct 2024 01:05:21 +0000 Record-breaking shearer Jamie Skiffington, pictured in a two-stand success near Whanganui, is now lining-up one of the biggest challenges of them all, in a woolshed near Dannevirke. Photo / Supplied.

Honey Bear manslaughter trial: Himatjit Kahlon’s lawyers say he was naive about meth-tainted beer’s risk https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/honey-bear-manslaughter-trial-himatjit-kahlons-lawyers-say-he-was-naive-about-meth-tainted-beers-risk/PBBNUP53URAJRO5ZEQS4VDPMWQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/honey-bear-manslaughter-trial-himatjit-kahlons-lawyers-say-he-was-naive-about-meth-tainted-beers-risk/PBBNUP53URAJRO5ZEQS4VDPMWQ/ Craig KapitanAiden Sagala overdosed after he drank a beer given to him by the defendant. Wed, 23 Oct 2024 00:59:37 +0000 Himatiit "Jimmy" Kahlon appears in the dock at the High Court at Auckland at the start of his manslaughter trial. He is accused of causing the death of Aiden Sagala, who collapsed after drinking beer unknowlingly laced with methamphetamine.

Rotorua motorcycle business raided for ‘fifth time in two years’ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/rotorua-motorcycle-business-raided-for-fifth-time-in-two-years/GQEYAWDJP5GH5IXMNME72EIF74/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/rotorua-motorcycle-business-raided-for-fifth-time-in-two-years/GQEYAWDJP5GH5IXMNME72EIF74/ Kaitlyn Morrell'You start thinking, is it worth carrying on a business with this happening all the time?' Quality Roading and Services returns $1.05 million to Wairoa community over last year https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/quality-roading-and-services-returns-105-million-to-wairoa-community-over-last-year/JNOG3UF2E5EUNKML56BZKGDYMY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/quality-roading-and-services-returns-105-million-to-wairoa-community-over-last-year/JNOG3UF2E5EUNKML56BZKGDYMY/ Wynsley WrigleyQRS reported a record $47.9 million in revenue, boosting sponsorship and council payments. Wed, 23 Oct 2024 00:03:29 +0000 Quality Roading and Services (QRS) temporary traffic management staff Jonathan Rumble and Atareta Smith prepare for another day of roading repairs and maintenance near Wairoa. QRS has recorded a pre-tax profit of $4.4 million and has distributed $1.05 million to owner Wairoa District Council and provided $205,000 in sponsorship of community events and youth initiatives.

Auckland contractor fined for ‘extensive violations’ of Resource Management Act https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/contractor-fined-for-extective-violations-of-resource-management-act/Q5YYXYJ7CZBQXL5TYLXSHNPM7U/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/contractor-fined-for-extective-violations-of-resource-management-act/Q5YYXYJ7CZBQXL5TYLXSHNPM7U/ Drury contractor Prameet Sharma was fined $144,500 for the violations.
